intro: Agoseris humilis, commonly known as the dwarf agoseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It features slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish to white ray flowers. Agoseris humilis is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
